=====================

### Tender Notice

#### Title

Stage 1 - Design Water Treatment Plant - Control Systems, Riding Mountain National Park

#### Reference Number

cb-289-99277482

#### Solicitation Number

5P468-23-0170/A

#### Publication Date

14 November 2023

#### Tender Closing Date

04 January 2024, 16:00:00

### Tender Description

Parks Canada is seeking proposals from qualified consultants to provide a plan for the upgrade of the water/wastewater treatment system software throughout Wasagaming in Riding Mountain National Park. The proposed project will include automation system upgrades to the Water Treatment Plant, Pumphouse, West Lift Station, Lagoon, East Lift Station, and Main (South) Lift Station.

A two-stage selection process will be employed. Stage 1 will evaluate the qualifications of all interested suppliers, and Stage 2 will invite qualified suppliers to provide further qualifications and a financial proposal on the project based on the Project Brief. Upon award of contract in Stage 2, the pre-qualification list will expire and will not be used in any other solicitation.

### Submission Instructions

Proposals received by fax and email will be accepted as official. However, please note that Parks Canada is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba. Bidders must submit their proposals via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document. Proposals received in-person or by courier will not be accepted.

The only acceptable email address for responses to proposal solicitations is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Proposals submitted by email directly to the Contracting Authority or to any email address other than soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca will not be accepted.

The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes. The Proponent is responsible for any failure attributable to the transmission or receipt of the emailed proposal due to file size.

### Contact Information

For any technical and contractual inquiries, please contact the Contracting Authority.

### Bidders' Conference

A bidders' conference will be held via teleconference on 29 November 2023 at 9:00 AM CDT. The scope of the requirement outlined in the bid solicitation will be reviewed during the conference, and questions will be answered. It is recommended that bidders who intend to submit a bid participate.

Please communicate with the Contracting Authority before the conference to confirm participation and obtain the dial-in coordinates.
